metadata.title: CVE-2022-38472 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could have abused XSLT error handling to associateattacker-controlled content with another origin which was displayed in theaddress bar. This could have been used to fool the user into submittingdata intended for the spoofed origin. This vulnerability affectsThunderbird < 102.2, Thunderbird < 91.13, Firefox ESR < 91.13, Firefox ESR< 102.2, and Firefox < 104.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-38472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '104.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.2.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
